ranked_diseases.explanation: Caused by SMARCB1 mutations, this syndrome is the most common genetic cause of atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors (AT/RT) in young children, with onset typically before age 3.
Caused by SMARCA4 mutations, this is a less common cause of AT/RT but still presents in early childhood with similar features to RTPS1.
While primarily associated with other cancers, TP53 mutations can rarely cause AT/RT in young children as part of the broader cancer predisposition spectrum.
CMMRD can present with various brain tumors in childhood including rare cases of AT/RT, though more commonly associated with gliomas.
While primarily associated with medulloblastoma, PTCH1 mutations have been rarely reported in association with other CNS tumors including AT/RT.
